action.action-desc: Ms. Schakowsky (for herself, Mr. Deutch, Ms. Norton, Ms. Matsui, Mr. Engel, Ms. Pingree, Mr. Polis, Mr. Ellison, Mr. Takano, Mr. Scott of Virginia, Mr. Pocan, Mr. Sarbanes, Ms. McCollum, Mr. Lewis of Georgia, and Ms. Moore) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend the Public Health Service Act to establish a public health insurance option, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Consumer Health Options and Insurance Competition Enhancement Act or the CHOICE Act.

subsection.text: Part C of title XXVII of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 300gg–91) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: For plan years beginning in 2019, the Secretary shall establish, and provide for the offering through the Exchanges, of a qualified health plan (in this Act referred to as the public health insurance option) that provides value, choice, competition, and stability of affordable, high-quality coverage throughout the United States in accordance with this section.
In designing the public health insurance option, the primary responsibility of the Secretary shall be to create an affordable health plan without compromising quality or access to care.

subsection.header: Administrating the public health insurance option

subparagraph.text: The public health insurance option shall be made available through the Exchanges.

Consistent with this section, the public health insurance option shall comply with requirements under title I of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, and the amendments made by that title, that are applicable to health plans offered through the Exchanges, including requirements related to benefits, benefit levels, provider networks, notices, consumer protections, and cost-sharing.
The public health insurance option shall offer bronze, silver, and gold plans.

The Secretary may enter into contracts for the purpose of performing administrative functions (including functions described in subsection (a)(4) of section 1874A of the Social Security Act) with respect to the public health insurance option in the same manner as the Secretary may enter into contracts under subsection (a)(1) of such section. The Secretary shall have the same authority with respect to the public health insurance option as the Secretary has under such subsection (a)(1) and subsection (b) of section 1874A of the Social Security Act with respect to title XVIII of such Act.
Any contract under this paragraph shall not involve the transfer of insurance risk from the Secretary to the entity entering into such contract with the Secretary.
The Secretary shall establish an office of the ombudsman for the public health insurance option.
Such ombudsman shall—

clause.text: have duties with respect to the public health insurance option similar to the duties of the Medicare Beneficiary Ombudsman under section 1808(c)(2) of the Social Security Act; and
work with States to ensure that information and notice is provided that the public health insurance option is one of the health plans available through an Exchange.

subparagraph.text: A State may establish a public or nonprofit entity to serve as the State Advisory Council to provide recommendations to the Secretary on the operations and policies of the public health insurance option offered through the Exchange operating in the State.
A State Advisory Council established under subparagraph (A) shall provide recommendations on at least the following:

clause.text: Policies and procedures to integrate quality improvement and cost containment mechanisms into the health care delivery system.
Mechanisms to facilitate public awareness of the availability of the public health insurance option.
Alternative payment models and value-based insurance design under the public health insurance option that encourage quality improvement and cost control.

subparagraph.text: The members of any State Advisory Council shall be representatives of the public and include health care consumers and health care providers.
The Secretary may apply the recommendations of a State Advisory Council to the public health insurance option in that State, in any other State, or in all States.

paragraph.text: The Secretary shall collect such data as may be required—

subparagraph.text: to establish rates for premiums and health care provider reimbursement under subsection (c); and
for other purposes under this section, including to improve quality, and reduce racial, ethnic, and other disparities, in health and health care.

subsection.header: Financing the public health insurance option

subparagraph.text: The Secretary shall establish geographically adjusted premium rates for the public health insurance option—

clause.text: in a manner that complies with the requirement for premium rates under subparagraph (C) and considers the data collected under subsection (b)(4); and
at a level sufficient to fully finance—

subclause.text: the costs of health benefits provided by the public health insurance option; and
administrative costs related to operating the public health insurance option.

subparagraph.text: In establishing premium rates under subparagraph (A), the Secretary shall include an appropriate amount for a contingency margin.
The premium rate charged for the public health insurance option may not vary except as provided under section 2701.

paragraph.header: Health care provider payment rates for items and services

clause.text: Not later than January 1, 2018, and except as provided in clause (ii), the Secretary shall, through a negotiated agreement with health care providers, establish rates for reimbursing health care providers for providing the benefits covered by the public health insurance option.

If the Secretary and health care providers are unable to reach a negotiated agreement on a reimbursement rate, the Secretary shall reimburse providers at rates determined for equivalent items and services under the original medicare fee-for-service program under parts A and B of title XVIII of the Social Security Act.

The Secretary shall modify reimbursement rates described in clause (ii) in order to accommodate payments for services, such as well-child visits, that are not otherwise covered under the original medicare fee-for-service program.

subparagraph.text: Any payment rate under this subsection for a prescription drug shall be at a rate negotiated by the Secretary. If the Secretary is unable to reach a negotiated agreement on such a reimbursement rate, the Secretary shall use rates determined for equivalent drugs paid for under the original medicare fee-for-service program. The Secretary shall modify such rates in order to accommodate payments for drugs that are not otherwise covered under the original medicare fee-for-service program.

There is established in the Treasury of the United States an account for the receipts and disbursements attributable to the operation of the public health insurance option, including the start-up funding under subparagraph (C) and appropriations authorized under subparagraph (D).

subparagraph.header: Prohibition of State imposition of taxes
subparagraph.text: Section 1854(g) of the Social Security Act shall apply to receipts and disbursements described in subparagraph (A) in the same manner as such section applies to payments or premiums described in such section.

clause.text: There are authorized to be appropriated such sums as may be necessary to establish the public health insurance option and cover 90 days of claims reserves based on projected enrollment.
The Secretary shall provide for the repayment of the startup funding provided under clause (i) to the Treasury in an amortized manner over the 10-year period beginning on January 1, 2019.

subparagraph.text: To carry out paragraph (2) of subsection (b), there are authorized to be appropriated such sums as may be necessary.
The Secretary shall establish conditions of participation for health care providers under the public health insurance option.
The Secretary shall not allow a health care provider to participate in the public health insurance option unless such provider is appropriately licensed or certified under State law.

A health care provider that is a participating provider of services or supplier under the Medicare program under title XVIII of the Social Security Act or under a State Medicaid plan under title XIX of such Act is a participating provider in the public health insurance option unless the health care provider opts out of participating in the public health insurance option through a process established by the Secretary.
The Secretary shall establish a process to allow health care providers not described in subparagraph (A) to become participating providers in the public health insurance option.

paragraph.header: Treatment as a qualified health plan
paragraph.text: Section 1301(a)(2) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (42 U.S.C. 18021(a)(2)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the paragraph heading, by inserting , the public health insurance option, before and; and
by inserting the public health insurance option under section 2795 of the Public Health Service Act, before and a multi-State plan.

paragraph.text: Section 1324(a) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (42 U.S.C. 18044(a)) is amended by inserting the public health insurance option under section 2795 of the Public Health Service Act, before or a multi-State qualified health plan.
